bibl.title: Aleksandria Shatby Nekropolisinde Ele Geçen Amphora Mühürleri. [Stamped Amphora Handles from the Necropolis of Shatby in Alexandria.]
bibl.note: In 1981, during the excavations in the necropolis, Egyptian archaeologists discovered some material including a group of amphora stamps. Five amphora stamps belong to Rhodian origin and are dated between the late third century and the second century BC. One of them is given to the first century BC. - Avec résumés en turc et en anglais.
bibl.seg: Gonca Cankardeş-Şenol, Aleksandria Shatby Nekropolisinde Ele Geçen Amphora Mühürleri. [Stamped Amphora Handles from the Necropolis of Shatby in Alexandria.]

In 1981, during the excavations in the necropolis, Egyptian archaeologists discovered some material including a group of amphora stamps. Five amphora stamps belong to Rhodian origin and are dated between the late third century and the second century BC. One of them is given to the first century BC. - Avec résumés en turc et en anglais.
